metadata.title: CVE-2023-52462 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: bpf:fix check for attempt to corrupt spilled pointer When register is spilledonto a stack as a 1/2/4-byte register, we set slot_type[BPF_REG_SIZE - 1](plus potentially few more below it, depending on actual spill size). So tocheck if some stack slot has spilled register we need to consultslot_type[7], not slot_type[0]. To avoid the need to remember anddouble-check this in the future, just use is_spilled_reg() helper.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic-64k - 6.8.0-11.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-aws - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-azure - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1002-gcp - 6.8.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-ibm - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency - 6.8.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-oracle - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1001-raspi - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
